intro: Hieracium flosculosum, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often reddish in color. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieracium flosculosum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
